str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Hated, hostile; subst: an enemy. From a primary echtho; hateful; usually as a noun, an adversary.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be hungry, needy, desire earnestly. From the same as penes; to famish; figuratively, to crave.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To feed, dole out. From the base of psomion; to supply with bits, i.e. to nourish.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To thirst for, desire earnestly. From a variation of dipsos; to thirst for.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To cause to drink, give to drink; irrigate, water. From a derivative of the alternate of pino; to furnish drink, irrigate.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To heap up, load. From another form of soros; to pile up.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.
Coal, charcoal, a burning coal. Of uncertain derivation; a live coal.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.
